title: It’s Official: SPACs Are the New Money-Market Funds
sub_head: Blank-check vehicles may now be in demand more as sources of risk-free arbitrage than as ways to invest in exciting startups
body:
Investing in SPACs isn’t about the adrenaline rush it used to be.
As markets sour on speculative assets, a new exchange-traded fund is offering a twist on investing in special-purpose acquisition companies. Sometimes called “blank-check” vehicles, SPACs last year became Wall Street’s favorite way to list flashy ventures with no profits.
